title: [BUG] MLflow permission errors when creating Sagemaker Serverless endpoints

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [X] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
MLFlow 1.20.2
AWS Sagemaker Serverless

### Describe the problem
AWS Sagemaker has introduced a [serverless inference solution](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/dg/serverless-endpoints.html) that supposedly is seamless with the models/docker containers used with real-time inference.   However using the `mlflow-pyfunc` 1.20.2 image, that does work with real-time inference endpoints, when standing up a serverless endpoint I get a `Permission denied: '/opt/mlflow/conda.yaml'` error that causes the endpoint to fail creation.

### Code to reproduce issue
1. Train an sklearn model and log with MLflow (`mlflow.sklearn.log_model()`)
2. Create and push container to AWS ECR using `mlflow sagemaker build-and-push-container`
3. Create Sagemaker model from model.tar.gz using the image created above
4. Create [Sagemaker endpoint configuration](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/dg/serverless-endpoints-create.html#serverless-endpoints-create-config) for the newly created model
5. Create Sagemaker endpoint using the configuration
6. Wait for the endpoint to be created - fails with `Permission denied: '/opt/mlflow/conda.yaml'`

### Other info / logs
Cloudwatch logs for the endpoint that failed to create...

```2022-03-18T11:46:40.882-04:00	OpenBLAS WARNING - could not determine the L2 cache size on this system, assuming 256k
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	Traceback (most recent call last):
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	File "/miniconda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py", line 44, in _init
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	_serve()
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	File "/miniconda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py", line 71, in _serve
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	_serve_pyfunc(m)
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	File "/miniconda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py", line 124, in _serve_pyfunc
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	_install_pyfunc_deps(MODEL_PATH, install_mlflow=True)
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	File "/miniconda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py", line 98, in _install_pyfunc_deps
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	shutil.copyfile(os.path.join(MODEL_PATH, env), env_path_dst)
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	File "/miniconda/lib/python3.8/shutil.py", line 261, in copyfile
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	with open(src, 'rb') as fsrc, open(dst, 'wb') as fdst:
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/opt/mlflow/conda.yaml'
2022-03-18T11:46:44.293-04:00	creating and activating custom environment
```


### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [X] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

Language 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [X] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
